title: Parras Wines 2016 Quinta do Gradil Ruelas Reserva Red (Lisboa)
description: Made with a selection of grapes from Quinta do Gradil, this oak-aged wine is rich, generous and smooth. Ripe black fruits give it a warm character, with spice and rich tannins that support the fruit. The wine will age a little further before it is ready to drink. Wait until late 2018.

title: Pepi Lignana 2014 Cerida  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This 100% Sangiovese opens with iris, raspberry and Mediterranean scrub aromas. The easygoing palate offers red cherry, raspberry jam and star anise alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.

title: Pflüger 2015 Cuvée Noir Red (Pfalz)
description: Complexities of leather and bitter chocolate lend a rustic note to lush blackberry and plum flavors. It's a soft, plump wine, with delicate acidity and fine, feathery tannins fringing the finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Phelps Creek 2016 Gorge Crest Gewürztraminer (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: Made in a solid, chunky style, this emphasizes fruit over floral characteristics. Flavors of white melon, sweet herb and lychee come with just a hint of talcum powder. It's finished dry and ready to drink while young and fresh.

title: Rafael Cambra 2015 El Bon Homme Red (Valencia)
description: Gamy, savory plum and berry aromas recall asphalt, tree bark and wildness. This blend offering Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Monastrell is clampy and tannic. Oaky savory berry flavors finish choppy, with a hint of clove.

title: Ribafreixo 2016 Barrancôa White (Alentejano)
description: Crisp, cool Síria gives this wine a bright and refreshing character. Minerality and apple and citrus flavors are delicious and very direct. Lightly textured and fruity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Rock Point 2016 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: This is a chunky wine with fruit leaning to the green (but still ripe) side of flavors. Apple, lime and grapefruit are in play, with a touch of bitter skin flavors also. It's balanced and persistent, with the structure to accompany poultry seasoned with fresh herbs.

title: San Marzano 2015 Talò Malvasia Nera (Salento)
description: This single-variety Malvasia Nera is dense in purple-fruit aromas, with accents of violets, anise and menthol. The fruity, soft palate offers plenty of ripe dark-fruit flavors, balanced by fresh acidity and black plum-skin tannins.

title: San Marzano 2015 Talò Negroamaro (Salento)
description: Spicy, dense aromas of tobacco leaf, briar berries and tilled earth make for an engaging nose. The palate is a bit more primary in ripe dark fruit flavors, yet solidly balanced by fresh acidity and savory, medium-grained tannins.

title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Estate Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This remains stiffly compact, showing blue and purple fruits with a seam of chocolate mint. It was barrel aged entirely in neutral oak, and the tannins are smooth and polished. A bit of aeration would help to open it up.

title: The Three Foxes 2015 Carignan (Swartland)
description: This wine is surprisingly dense and dark in aromatic character, with brooding notes of black cherry, cassis and blackberry that set the stage for an equally concentrated palate. The astringent tannins lend good grip, framing the plush, ripe fruit. Final hints of tree bark, chicory and char spice up the close.

title: Three of Cups 2014 Le Jugement Lonesomes Springs Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)
description: Syrah makes up half of this wine, with the rest equal parts Grenache and Mourvèdre. Aromas of marionberry, herb, smoked meat and spice lead to a well-balanced palate that glides on the baking-spice-filled finish. The oak plays a bit prominently at times but overall it works.

title: Tolosa 2016 Poletti Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is an unctuous tale on Chardonnay, very much in line with the classic Californian style. Aromas of baked Asian pear, oak, butterscotch and caramel show on the nose, leading into a broad, buttery and viscous palate of lemon balm and coconut cream.

title: Twin Cedars 2014 Merlot (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: Inviting aromas of cherry cordial, dried herb and chalk lead to generous, well-fashioned fruit flavors. Light tannins provide support.

title: Watermill 2014 Anna Marie Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The barrel influence is primarily aromatical with notes of nougat, vanilla and sweet spices out in front of cherry and red apple. The fruit vies with the oak for attention on the palate as well, although the latter shows a pleasing supple feel as well as excellent concentration. There's impressive fruit here, but the oak unfortunately gets in the way of it.

title: Casteani 2013 Sessanta  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Alicante, this presents aromas of red-skinned berry, new leather and baking spice. The juicy easydrinking palate offers raspberry jam, tobacco and cinnamon alongside polished tannins.

title: Castello Monaci 2014 Aiace Riserva Red (Salice Salentino)
description: Slightly sauced red berry aromas meld with earth and floral tones on the nose. There's a smooth feel to the medium-bodied palate, with sandy, fine-grained tannins and zesty acidity housing flavors of tilled earth and racy red fruit. A lean graphite edge runs from start to finish, keeping this focused and perfectly food friendly.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Beautifully aromatic hints of Williams pear play on the nose. The palate stays in the same vein, yet ultimately this is easy, friendly and very appetizing. Drink soon.

title: Charles Sparr 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Very appetizing notes of ripe, juicy and aromatic pear are immediately apparent. The juicy palate frames these lively fruit notes with great freshness. The finish is a little warm but dry and refreshing.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2009 200 Monges Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Chunky black-fruit aromas are in the overripe zone, with a smoky offset. A raw palate is bolstered by citrusy acidity that creates a screechy mouthfeel. Flavors of plum skins and orange peel are good.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Trittenheimer Apotheke Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Voluptuous, slightly overripe notes of yellow peach, pineapple and red berry are accented by caramel and smoke in this off-dry kabinett. High-toned acidity lends balance to the midpalate leading to a refreshingly mineral finish.

title: Bott Frères 2016 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Lovely freshness of cut Conference pear rises from the glass. The rounded palate offers more fruit yet is maintained by a fresh vein of acidity.

title: Château Laride 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: Ripe and fruity, this is becoming a delicious wine. The black-currant fruits from the Cabernet Sauvignon give both richness and crispness. With good acidity and a touch of wood, the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Château Lassus 2015  Médoc
description: This well-balanced wine offers a great mix of tannins and juicy fruit, It is rich and likely to be delicious as it matures, conveying weight as well as blackberry flavors and acidity in abundance. The wine needs to age over the medium term. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Meyre 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, still a rare concept in the Médoc, this wine from vineyards close to Margaux is stylish, fruity and elegant. Dry tannins form part of a juicy wine with blackberry fruits. Likely to age well over the next few years, it will be ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château Pierre de Montignac 2015  Médoc
description: This 60-acre estate has produced a spicy, wood-laden wine. Rich fruit saves the wine from being overwhelmed by the toastiness and gives it the necessary weight. It will need time, so drink this wine from 2023.

title: Château Saint Ahon 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This is a structured, dense wine produced in the southern Haut-Médoc, close to Bordeaux. It is packed with dry tannins that give an austere character. The weight hints at the black-currant fruit to come. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Saint-Hilaire 2015  Médoc
description: This structured, balanced wine offers both rich black-currant fruit and some serious tannins. It is developing well, with the balance between Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot giving a juicy character as well as plenty of ripe jamminess. Give the wine until 2023.

title: Dalton 2016 Alma Ivory White (Galilee)
description: Pale straw to the eye, this wine has aromas of pear and vanilla. It is bright from first sip through the grapefruit finish, while also offering a sense of creaminess on the palate among flavors of green apple and peach, with a touch of vanilla custard.

title: Di Bruno 2013 Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tangy fruits of pomegranate, strawberry and orange rind meet with dried ginger and Christmas spice on the nose of this bottling. It's light and easy on the palate, sailing through with bright red fruits and hints of herbs.
